meanings.definition: To make larger or greater in size or extent.
meanings.sent1: She amplified her drawing by adding more colors.
meanings.sent2: The teacher amplified the lesson with extra examples.
meanings.sent3: The cake was already big, but she amplified it by adding extra layers.
meanings.sent4: His excitement amplified as he got closer to the finish line.
meanings.sent5: The mountain range amplified the beauty of the landscape.

meanings.definition: To increase the volume or intensity of sound.
meanings.sent1: He amplified his guitar to play louder in the concert.
meanings.sent2: The technician amplified the microphone for better sound quality.
meanings.sent3: The cat meowed loudly, as if it wanted to be amplified.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter amplified through the entire room.
meanings.sent5: The thunderstorm amplified the noise outside.

meanings.definition: To add details or expand upon a topic.
meanings.sent1: The author amplified the story by including more background information.
meanings.sent2: The presenter amplified the presentation with interesting facts.
meanings.sent3: The joke was already funny, but he amplified it with a hilarious punchline.
meanings.sent4: Her speech amplified the importance of environmental conservation.
meanings.sent5: The documentary amplified the impact of climate change.
